distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
libtasn1 has been updated to fix three security issues:

    * asn1_get_bit_der() could have returned negative bit length
      (CVE-2014-3468)
    * Multiple boundary check issues could have allowed DoS (CVE-2014-3467)
    * Possible DoS by NULL pointer dereference in asn1_read_value_type
      (CVE-2014-3469)

Security Issues:

    * CVE-2014-3468
      <http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3468>
    * CVE-2014-3467
      <http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3467>
    * CVE-2014-3469
      <http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3469>
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the DER decoder in GNU Libtasn1 before 3.6, as used in GnuTLS, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via crafted ASN.1 data.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: The asn1_get_bit_der function in GNU Libtasn1 before 3.6 does not properly report an error when a negative bit length is identified, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause out-of-bounds access via crafted ASN.1 data.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: The (1) asn1_read_value_type and (2) asn1_read_value functions in GNU Libtasn1 before 3.6 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) via a NULL value in an ivalue argument.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: Stack-based buffer overflow in asn1_der_decoding in libtasn1 before 4.4 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via unknown vectors.
notes.title: CVE description
